revised_title: Confirmation of the Jones-Richards Experiment and the Role of Optical Radiation Pressure in Dispersive Media
tldr: The authors conducted an experiment to measure the optical radiation pressure in dispersive media using a torsion balance and a laser beam. They confirmed the results of the Jones-Richards experiment, showing that the momentum associated with electromagnetic radiation increases directly with the refractive index of the medium. The experiment also demonstrated that the magnitude of recoil of a mirror in oblique incidence does not vary when the plane of polarization is changed.
